snippet: President Obama won the support of Republican and Democratic leaders in the House for an attack on Syria, as a Senate panel agreed on the wording for a measure to permit military action.
abstract: Senate panel agrees on wording of measure to permit military action in Syria, giving Pres Obama the authority to carry out a strike for a period of 60 days, with one 30-day extension; if approved, measure would be sent to the full Senate for a vote.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER, MICHAEL R. GORDON and THOM SHANKER
byline.contributor: Jennifer Steinhauer, Ashley Parker and Jeremy Peters contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: President Obama won the support of Republican and Democratic leaders in the House for an attack on Syria, as a Senate panel agreed on the wording for a measure to permit military action.

headline.main: House Leaders Express Their Support for Syria Strike
headline.print_headline: House’s Leaders Express Support For Syria Strike
